titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Resident at Bushire to Neil Benjamin Edmonstone, Secretary in the Secret, Political and Foreign Department, Fort William, Calcutta

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage which has resulted in a few minor holes in the folios. These holes obscure some of the text of the letter, which makes it a little tricky to read in places.

mods.abstract: The letter contains information the Resident has obtained regarding the capture of a vessel, the Shannon, which was previously owned by Mahomed Nebee Khan [Muḥammad Nabī Khān]. It further reports that it is believed that the English captain and crew have been killed and advocates that action should be taken against the pirates.One enclosure; a translation of a letter from Hajee Mohumed Jemaul Kongoon of [Kangān] Congoon, received 2 December 1807. It details the circumstances surrounding the capture of the Shannonby the Jowasme [Qāsimī] tribe near the Island of Soorree.
